isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - CATERPILLAR 3176B/3406E ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - 1994 - DIAGNOSTICS - DETERMINING FAULT CODES

svcprocinfo.para: MPSI (Prolink) or Caterpillar electronic service tools (EST) can be used to identify logged fault codes. Refer to the EST manual for operating instructions.
The yellow "Engine Warning" light can be used to read fault codes by following the procedure in paragraph Reading Flash Codes.

step1.para: Turn the key to the ON position. The Yellow Oil/Water Warning light will turn ON for approximately five seconds, then turn OFF for several more seconds, then begins to FLASH any logged codes.

note.para: All Caterpillar flash codes are two digit numbers.

step1.para: The yellow Engine Warning light will FLASH the first digit. At the end of first digit there is a one or two second pause.
The yellow Engine Warning light will FLASH the second digit. At the end of the second digit there will be a two or three second pause before the next fault code number is FLASHED.
The second and all successive fault codes will FLASH until all codes have been FLASHED. It will stop FLASHING after the last code has been flashed. To see the fault codes again, repeat the process.

Flash code 55 indicates that there are no logged diagnostic codes. For a listing of Caterpillar Flash codes, refer to the Caterpillar Electronic Troubleshooting manual. Codes are also listed in the Prolink manual.
Start engine and allow to run at low idle for about 30 seconds.
Turn Cruise ON/OFF switch to OFF position.
Hold Cruise SET/RESUME switch in either position until codes begin to FLASH, then release.

note.para: All Caterpillar flash codes are two digit numbers.

step1.para: The yellow Engine Warning light will FLASH the first digit. At the end of first digit there is a one or two second pause.
The yellow Engine Warning light will FLASH the second digit. At the end of the second digit there will be a two or three second pause before the next fault code number is FLASHED.

The second and all successive fault codes will FLASH until all codes have been FLASHED. It will stop FLASHING after the last code has been flashed. To see the fault codes again, repeat steps 4 through 6.

Flash code 55 indicates that there are no logged diagnostic codes. For a listing of Caterpillar Flash codes, refer to the Caterpillar Electronic Troubleshooting manual. Codes are also listed in the Prolink manual.
